content.prompt:
Listen to the excerpt.


The harmonic progression heard is Ⅰ6—?—ⅱ7—Ⅴ7—Ⅰ. Which of the following statements most accurately describes the voice leading from the second to the third chord?

choices.label: The second chord is a Ⅳ7 chord; the chordal seventh is in the soprano and resolves down by step to the root of the ⅱ7.
The second chord is a Ⅳ42 chord; the chordal seventh is in the bass and resolves down by step to the root of the ⅱ7.
The second chord is a Ⅰ65 chord; the chordal seventh is in the inner voice and resolves down by step to the fifth of the ⅱ7.
The second chord is a ⅳ64 chord; there is no chordal seventh.

unit.text: 5: Harmony and Voice Leading II - Chord Progressions and Predominant Function

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Use symbols and terms to describe and apply harmonic, melodic, and rhythmic procedures of 18th-century voice leading (up to 4 voices) in performed music.
